title: Beginner English 112
headline: This free online beginner English course explains past tense endings, past simple forms and common past time phrases.
description: This English course will introduce you to the different pronunciations of past tense endings, which include -ed as /d/, /t/, or /id/. You will learn how to use the past tense affirmative and the negative form, as well as how to form yes or no and information questions. The vocabulary topic examines common time expressions in the past, discussing past events and activities. Don't delay. Level up your English skills today.
courseDescription:
English is a diverse language needing many skills to master its nuances. We have designed this course to help you learn the pronunciation, grammar, and vocabulary relating to the past. To start, you will discover past tense endings. Past tense verbs have three different endings, which include -ed as /d/, /t/, or /id/.

The second section of the course covers some grammar points. You will learn about the past tense 'be,' including the positive and negative forms. You will remember to include words such as 'there was' or 'there were' before moving on to the past simple tense using regular and irregular verbs. You will discover how to ask 'past time' questions that include yes/no answers before asking questions that need answers with more detail.

This course's final section looks at past everyday time expressions. You use these expressions when something has happened in the past. You will master time-related words and phrases like 'in,' 'on,' 'at,' 'yesterday,' 'last,' and 'ago.' Gain the ability to discuss past events and talk about past activities. This course uses audio and videos to help you grasp these skills and encourage conversation. Enroll today and become familiar with the areas using the past.
